headline: LEAG enlists HyperStrong for 1.6GWh Germany BESS
summary_80w: Utility and power firm LEAG has partnered with Chinese system integrator HyperStrong for a 400MW/1,600MWh BESS in Saxony, Germany.

headline: Econergy connects 52MW Resko solar project in Poland under Apple virtual PPA
summary_80w: Econergy Renewable Energy has successfully connected its 52MW Resko solar project in Poland to the national electricity grid.

headline: Report: US DOE will need to invest US$25 billion in energy security by 2030
summary_80w: The US Department of Energy (DOE) will need to invest US$25 billion by 2030 to maintain its position as a leader in the global energy sector.

headline: PVV Infra planning 1GW TOPCon solar cell in Andhra Pradesh
summary_80w: PVV Infra has outlined plans to build a 1GW TOPCon solar cell production line in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.

headline: Solar leads clean energy investment, more capital needed to deliver energy transition – IRENA
summary_80w: The world invested US$554 billion into solar PV projects in 2024, leading renewable electricity generation sources, according to IRENA.

headline: Gunning for growth: European investors snap up Recurrent Energy’s 275MWdc solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: Recurrent Energy has sold its 275MWdc Gunning hybrid solar-plus-storage project in New South Wales, Australia.

headline: Hydrostor and 3CE amend Willow Rock ESA for third time, ‘permitting and interconnection challenges’ to blame
summary_80w: An energy storage agreement (ESA) between Toronto, Ontario-headquartered developer Hydrostor and California community choice aggregator (CCA) Central Coast Community Energy (3CE) is set to be amended for the third time.

headline: VIDEO: What the EU Batteries Regulation means for the BESS industry
summary_80w: The EU Batteries Regulation came into force in 2023, but its various stipulations become law over the next several years. What does it mean for Europe's BESS developers, operators and suppliers?

headline: ‘Europe’s fastest-growing clean energy technology’: 100GW of energy storage installs
summary_80w: Europe is on track to reach 100GW of cumulative energy storage deployments this month, according to LCP Delta and Energy Storage Europe.

headline: OX2 acquires co-located wind and BESS developments in Western Australia
summary_80w: Swedish renewable energy developer OX2 has formally taken ownership of the 1.2GW Dinner Hill Wind Farm and the co-located 400MWh Harvest Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) in Western Australia.

headline: SECI, Andhra Pradesh government agree on 1,200MWh BESS and 50MW solar hybrid projects
summary_80w: Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) has agreed on BESS and hybrid solar developments with the Government of Andhra Pradesh.

headline: Tata Power commissions 300MW NHPC solar PV project in Rajasthan
summary_80w: Tata Power Renewable Energy has commissioned a 300MW solar PV project for Indian hydropower company NHPC in Rajasthan.

headline: US non-lithium energy storage startups ESS Inc, Eos foresee policy and load growth tailwinds ahead
summary_80w: The quarterly financial results of US non-lithium battery storage startups ESS Inc and Eos highlight their commercialisation strategies.

headline: Italy’s MACSE and CM revenues to become more competitive over time, optimiser says
summary_80w: The low level of the MACSE tariffs in Italy took everyone by surprise and will require careful asset management, but their relative value and those of the capacity market (CM) should increase over time.

headline: ‘Critical’ TOPCon module degradation is ‘in contrast’ to long panel warranties
summary_80w: TOPCon solar modules show signs of accelerated degradation, which undermines the long warranties promised by many manufacturers, according to new findings from German researchers.

headline: Holosolis secures over US$250 million, plans to build French module factory next year
summary_80w: Holosolis has secured €220 million (US$255.2 million) to support its construction of a module factory in France with a total capacity of 5GW.

headline: JinkoSolar module shipments, revenue fall in Q3 2025
summary_80w: JinkoSolar shipped just over 20GW of solar PV modules in the third quarter of this year, down sequentially from the previous quarter.

headline: Solar supply chains under the microscope: navigating Europe’s evolving ESG compliance landscape
summary_80w: PV Talk: George Touloupas of Intertek CEA explains how the regulatory environment is ratcheting up for the solar supply chain.

headline: 94MW Gunsynd solar project secures AEMO registration near NSW-Queensland divide
summary_80w: The 94MW Gunsynd Solar Farm has been registered in AEMO's Market Management System as the Queensland project prepares for commissioning.

headline: Sunrun: 70% battery storage attachment rates minimised US solar leaser’s losses in Q3 2025
summary_80w: US residential solar and energy storage installer Sunrun has posted revenue of US$724.6 million in the third quarter of this year, as the company implements its “storage-first strategy”.

headline: Australia breaks 40-year pumped hydro drought as 2GWh Kidston project enters the NEM
summary_80w: The 2GWh Kidston Pumped Hydro Project has been registered in the Australian Energy Market Operator's (AEMO) Market Management System (MMS).

headline: How US battery startup Alsym Energy’s sodium-ion systems aim to go where LFP cannot
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks with Mukesh Chatter of Alsym Energy about the potential advantages of sodium-ion energy storage.

headline: Ireland ‘enters new era’ with battery storage units participating in wholesale market for first time
summary_80w: New wholesale electricity market rules have been introduced in Ireland, designed to allow battery storage assets to participate directly.

headline: ‘Canada’s largest BESS’ at 1,858MWh begins construction, E-Storage is tech provider & EPC
summary_80w: E-Storage, Canadian Solar's energy storage subsidiary, has been contracted to provide engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) services on the 411MW/1,858MWh Skyview 2 battery energy storage system (BESS) in Edwardsburgh Cardinal, Ontario, CA.

headline: SunCable advances 20GW AAPowerLink project with Indigenous deals in Australia
summary_80w: Renewable energy developer SunCable has signed an Indigenous Land Use Agreement (ILUA) with the Powell Creek Native Title Holders, marking a milestone for the company’s AAPowerLink project in Australia's Northern Territory.

headline: Jakson Group begins construction of 6GW integrated solar manufacturing plant in India
summary_80w: Jakson Group has started Phase 1 construction of its 6GW integrated solar ingot, wafer, cell and module manufacturing facility at Maksi, Madhya Pradesh.

headline: Grid gaps and tender complexity put pressure on India’s 500GW roadmap
summary_80w: India’s race to 500GW is being slowed by critical grid bottlenecks, NTPC PMI’s Abhinav Jindal told PV Tech.

headline: Saatvik Solar secures PV module orders worth US$19.9 million
summary_80w: Saatvik Green Energy, through its subsidiary Saatvik Solar Industries, has secured solar PV module orders worth INR1.77 billion (US$19.9 million).

headline: First Solar to build new 3.7GW module facility in South Carolina
summary_80w: US solar module manufacturer First Solar will build a new production facility in the state of South Carolina, which will bring its US nameplate manufacturing capacity to 17.7GW by 2027.

headline: India’s renewable reckoning: grid gaps, tender failures and the road to 500GW
summary_80w: PV Talk: India’s race to 500GW of clean energy is being slowed by critical bottlenecks. NTPC PMI’s deputy general manager Abhinav Jindal tells Shreeyashi Ojha what steps India must urgently take to stay on track with its 2030 targets.

headline: Spain issues €200 million for ‘innovative’ agriPV, floating solar and energy storage
summary_80w: Spain has allocated up to €200 million (US$232 million) to fund “innovative” renewable energy and energy storage projects.

headline: German PV plant becomes first prequalified to provide secondary control power
summary_80w: Germany’s first ground-mounted PV plant has been prequalified for automatic frequency restoration reserve (aFRR) services. The industry first, a collaboration between Enerparc subsidiary Sunnic Lighthouse, Entelios and transmission system operator 50Hertz, demonstrates the potential for PV systems to provide grid stability services alongside renewable energy generation. The 37.4MWp Enerparc facility in Schkölen began commercial participation […]

headline: Rondo Energy deploys Southeast Asia’s ‘first industrial Heat Battery’
summary_80w: Rondo Energy and SCG Cleanergy have commenced operation of Southeast Asia's first industrial thermal battery energy storage system (BESS) at SCG's cement plant in Saraburi, Thailand.

headline: Australia to launch Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 8 seeking 16GWh energy storage in the NEM
summary_80w: Australia's DCCEEW has announced that the Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 8 will launch later this month seeking 16GWh of energy storage.

headline: VIDEO: Inside CAN networks – Solving core communication challenges in co-located renewables and BESS
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news presents our sponsored webinar with HMS Networks, 'Inside CAN Networks: Solving Core Communication Challenges in Co-located Renewables and BESS.'

headline: Acciona Energia to add 1GWh BESS to Chile solar PV plant
summary_80w: Spain-based developer Acciona Energia will add a gigawatt-hour-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) at its 238MWp Malgarida solar PV plant in Chile.

headline: Developer rPlus Energies acquires 900MW solar-plus-storage portfolio in Idaho
summary_80w: Developer rPlus Energies has acquired two solar and storage projects with the total capacity of 900MW in Ada County, Idaho.

headline: Statera secures debt finance for 1.36GWh UK BESS
summary_80w: BESS and flexible generation provider Statera Energy has secured £235 million (US$309 million) in debt financing for its 680MW/1,360MWh Carrington BESS project in Manchester, UK.

headline: Lightsource bp breaks ground on 330MWp Valle 3 and 4 solar cluster in Spain
summary_80w: Lightsource bp has started construction on its 330MWp Valle 3 and 4 project in Wamba, Valladolid, in the Castilla y Leon region of Spain.

headline: Canadian Solar sees solar slump and storage surge in steady Q3 2025 results
summary_80w: International solar manufacturer Canadian Solar has posted stable financials in Q3 2025, as its solar module and battery energy storage system (BESS) sales shift.

headline: Australia’s New South Wales streamlines rooftop solar for 1,810 heritage-listed properties
summary_80w: NSW has removed regulatory barriers that previously prevented owners of heritage-listed properties from installing rooftop solar.

headline: US sodium-ion startup Peak Energy deploying 720MWh BESS for Jupiter Power, with 4GWh under reservation
summary_80w: Sodium-ion (Na-ion) battery energy storage system (BESS) startup Peak Energy has announced a multi-year phased agreement with developer Jupiter Power to supply up to 4.75GWh of Na-ion BESS.

headline: Arizona county P&Z commission denies land use amendment for Nadara’s 200MW hybrid BESS project
summary_80w: The US development arm of Milan, Italy-headquartered developer Nadara has encountered a setback in its pursuit of a 200MW hybrid BESS destined for Arizona.

headline: Greece: PPC awards Trina Storage with 200MWh Western Macedonia BESS project contract
summary_80w: State-backed power firm PPC Renewables has launched construction on its a large-scale BESS in Greece, for which Trina Storage will supply the energy storage technology.

headline: China leads 29% October global BESS deployments increase
summary_80w: Nearly 70% of the 4.5GW/12.7GWh of grid-scale BESS that came online across the globe last month was in China.

headline: Acciona Energia retrofits 1GWh battery storage project to solar PV plant in Chile
summary_80w: Developer Acciona Energia will add a gigawatt-hour-scale battery energy storage system (BESS) at an existing solar PV plant in Chile.

headline: Australia: 350MW of utility-scale solar enters AEMO’s Market Management System
summary_80w: Recurrent Energy's 150MW Carwarp Solar Farm in Victoria and Global Power Generation (GPG) Australia's 200MW Glenellen Solar Farm in New South Wales have registered with AEMO’s Market Management System.

headline: Octopus Australia reaches financial close on 486MWh DC-coupled solar-plus-storage site
summary_80w: Octopus Australia has achieved financial close on a AU$900 million (US$587 million) DC-coupled hybrid facility that combines 300MW of solar generation with a 243MW/486MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in New South Wales.

headline: QIC and EDP sign exclusivity deal for 400MWac solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: QIC and EDP Renewables Australia have signed an agreement to develop a 400MWac solar-plus-storage project in Toowoomba, Queensland.

headline: Colorado votes to make Xcel Energy provide higher-quality data, introduce flexible tariffs
summary_80w: Xcel Energy will have to provide higher-quality data, and introduce flexible tariffs, following a vote from the Colorado PUC.

headline: Global solar generation up 31% in first nine months of 2025
summary_80w: The world generated 2,109.76TWh of electricity from solar in the first nine months of the year, a 31% increase over the same period in 2025.

headline: Create Energy advances US solar ‘one-stop-shop’ plan with Stäubli connector production deal
summary_80w: US solar hardware manufacturer Create Energy and Swiss cable producer Stäubli have announced a partnership to produce a new solar connector product.

headline: Corning holds the key to US-made wafer supply
summary_80w: Analysis: The opening of Corning's Michigan wafer plant puts it in a strong position to supply US-made, FEOC-compliant products, while competition from outside remains scarce.

headline: ‘Sunshot Programme could reshape Australia from a solar consumer to a manufacturing hub’
summary_80w: Building a solar manufacturing supply chain has become a "strategic imperative" for Australia, Stellar PV CEO Louise Hurll told PV Tech.

headline: Scaling solar in the Nordics – and lessons for Europe
summary_80w: Forget any preconceptions about solar power in the Nordics; the cold, seasonally dark region is fast becoming a solar success story, writes Annelie Westén.

headline: FTC Solar acquires Alpha Steel, revenue up 157% in Q3 2025
summary_80w: US tracker manufacturer FTC Solar has entered into a purchase agreement to acquire the remaining 55% stake in steel manufacturer Alpha Steel.

headline: Australia eyes solar independence with first domestic ingot and wafer production
summary_80w: PV Talk: Stellar PV has been awarded government funding for its plan to open a solar ingot and wafer plant in Australia. The company’s CEO Louise Hurll tells Shreeyashi Ojha why the time is right for Australia to develop its upstream manufacturing capacity.

headline: Atlas Renewable Energy powers 201MW PV plant in Colombia
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Atlas Renewable Energy has commissioned a 201MW solar PV plant in Colombia.

headline: Voltalia powers 126MW solar PV plant in Uzbekistan, co-located wind, BESS on the way
summary_80w: French renewables company Voltalia has started delivering electricity to the Uzbek grid at its 126MW solar PV plant.

headline: US EPA appoints ABTC to recycle up to 100,000 Li-ion battery modules from Moss Landing BESS
summary_80w: Critical minerals manufacturer and lithium-ion battery recycling company American Battery Technology Company (ABTC) has been selected to recycle batteries from the Moss Landing Energy Storage Facility in Monterey County, California, US.

headline: What an ICE raid on Hyundai and LG ES’ EV cell factory in Georgia could mean for BESS manufacturing
summary_80w: On 4 September, US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), along with multiple other law enforcement organisations, raided Hyundai Motor and LG Energy Solution’s electric vehicle (EV) battery cell plant in Ellabell, Georgia, US.

headline: HyperStrong and CATL enter 200GWh strategic cooperation
summary_80w: The three-year rolling partnership, whereby CATL will supply HyperStrong with cells and system products, could be updated annually.

headline: Germany: Statkraft, Kyon and Juniz commission, procure and finance projects totalling 213MWh of BESS
summary_80w: Statkraft, Kyon Energy and Juniz Energy have progressed BESS projects in Germany, all in all totalling a combined 213MWh of capacity.

headline: Ampyr Australia acquires 2,160MWh grid-forming BESS project in South Australia
summary_80w: Ampyr Australia has acquired the 270MW Davenport battery energy storage system (BESS) in South Australia from Green Gold Energy (GGE), renaming the facility the ‘Northern Battery’.

headline: Mooreast begins study to build up to 500MW floating renewables in Timor-Leste
summary_80w: Mooring solutions provider Mooreast has commenced feasibility studies to develop up to 500MW of floating renewables in Timor-Leste.

headline: Three battery projects totalling 720MW enter Australia’s federal environmental assessment
summary_80w: Three large-scale BESS with a combined capacity of 720MW have been submitted for federal assessment under Australia's EPBC Act.

headline: Nextracker becomes ‘Nextpower’ in strategic shift
summary_80w: Nextracker has rebranded itself as ‘Nextpower’ to reflect what the company said was its evolution from solar tracker supplier to a “full-platform” provider of integrated energy solutions.

headline: Economic and demographic trends to create opportunities for solar as world becomes ‘thirsty for energy’
summary_80w: Changing economic and demographic trends across the world will drive an increasingly complex energy mix over the coming years, says the IEA.

headline: Qcells furloughs 1,000 US employees following detention of solar cells by US Customs
summary_80w: Qcells has announced plans to reduce pay and working hours for one-third of its 3,000 employees in the US state of Georgia.

headline: Back contact solar technology: from premium niche to mainstream contender
summary_80w: PV Talk: Stefano N. Granata of STS discusses the growing momentum behind back contact cell technology as manufacturers and investors embrace higher-efficiency solutions.

headline: EBRD boosts equity in Infinity to US$141.5m to expand renewable capacity across Africa
summary_80w: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) has increased its equity stake in Infinity by US$40 million.

headline: SunPower continues expansion with Ambia Solar acquisition
summary_80w: US solar installer SunPower has continued its expansion in the residential market with the acquisition of Utah-based residential installer Ambia Solar.

headline: NEM data spotlight: Australia’s solar PV sector achieves record October performance with 4,715GWh
summary_80w: Solar PV in Australia’s National Electricity Market (NEM) made a strong showing across October 2025, reaching 4,715GWh – a 9.88% increase on the 4,291GWh recorded in October 2024.

headline: India: Adani makes ‘strategic entry’ into battery storage with 3.5GWh project
summary_80w: India’s Adani Group has made its first entry into the battery storage market, announcing a ‘flagship deployment’ that will be the country’s largest project so far when completed.

headline: 71% of Americans surveyed support energy storage, but ‘vocal minority’ kill or delay projects
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with Joe DeBellis, Global Head of Clean Energy at Firetrace International, about the company’s latest report detailing public support for battery energy storage systems (BESS).

headline: Energy Vault credits expanded markets and new strategies with Q3 2025 growth
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and system integrator Energy Vault has released its Q3 2025 financial results, showing growth credited to expanding projects in Australia and its ‘Asset Vault’ subsidiary.

headline: Finland: IPPs order BESS from Merus and Sungrow as market shifts to 2-hour systems
summary_80w: Two Finland BESS project announcements, with Exilion ordering grid-forming energy storage technology from Merus Power and Nala Renewables ordering units from Sungrow for 2-hour systems.

headline: How important is cell-to-ESS vertical integration?
summary_80w: Although vertically integrated ESS-cell suppliers retain more control over their supply chain, system integrators’ flexibility may help them in the medium-term, writes Solar Media Market Research analyst Charlotte Gisbourne.

headline: QIC, EDP partner for 1,600MWh solar-plus-storage project in Queensland, Australia
summary_80w: Queensland Investment Corporation (QIC) and EDP Renewables Australia have signed an exclusivity agreement to develop the Punchs Creek Renewable Energy Project, a 1,600MWh solar-plus-storage project in Queensland's Toowoomba region.

headline: SFI starts work on 1GW solar project in Ghana, country’s largest
summary_80w: SFI has started construction on the first phase of the Norbert Anku solar project in Ghana, which will have an operational capacity of 1GW.

headline: INDIA ROUND-UP: Emmvee launches IPO and ACME, Reliance secure FDRE tender
summary_80w: During a week marked by significant developments, ACME Solar and Reliance NU Energies win SJVN tenders while Emmvee launches IPO.

headline: Philippines awards over 6GW of solar capacity, over 1GW of solar-plus-storage, in latest auction
summary_80w: The Philippines has awarded 10.19GW of new energy capacity in its fourth auction round, with solar accounting for more than 6GW of capacity.

headline: Sunrun’s ‘storage-first’ strategy sees green shoots in Q3
summary_80w: Sunrun has posted revenue of US$724.6 million in the third quarter of this year, marking the third consecutive quarter of growth this year.

headline: Hassan Allam, Infinity Power to develop 1.2GW solar, 720MWh energy storage projects in Egypt
summary_80w: Hassan Allam Utilities Energy Platform and Infinity Power have signed agreements to develop two renewable energy projects in the country.

headline: Pacific Energy, Horizon Power sign 20-year PPA for solar hybrid in Western Australia
summary_80w: Developer Pacific Energy has signed a 20-year power purchase agreement (PPA) with Horizon Power to deliver a hybrid power system to the town of Leonora in Western Australia's goldfields, aiming for up to 60% renewable energy penetration by 2027.

headline: Egypt’s government, TSO sign agreements for Hassan Allam, Infinity Power’s solar-plus-storage
summary_80w: Hassan Allam Utilities and Infinity Power have signed agreements with Egypt's Ministry of Electricity and Renewable Energy and the Egyptian Electricity Transmission Company for two renewable energy projects in the country.

headline: Enlight secures US$1.44 billion for Arizona hybrid PV plant with 1,900MWh BESS
summary_80w: IPP Enlight Renewable Energy has secured a US$1.44 billion debt financing for the Snowflake A solar-plus-storage project in Holbrook, Arizona, US.

headline: NGK pulls plug on world’s second-most-deployed grid storage battery technology after BASF exit
summary_80w: Japan’s NGK Insulators has discontinued its sodium-sulfur (NAS) battery product line, with the exit of its partner, BASF, thought to have led to the final decision.

headline: VIDEO: The relevance of project customisation for Latin America’s successful adoption of BESS technologies
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Trina Storage, on the relevance of customisation for battery storage project success in Latin America.

headline: ‘Catastrophic failure’ of transformer at Waratah Super Battery, Australia’s ‘giant shock-absorber’ for the grid
summary_80w: Australia's Waratah Super Battery has been hit with a "catastrophic" failure at one of its transformers, reducing the project's capacity.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Fullmark California portfolio, Habitat-Ørsted Texas optimisation, flow battery player Quino secures funding
summary_80w: A roundup of battery energy storage system (BESS) stories from the US including Fullmark Energy’s 130MWh BESS reaching commercial operations, Habitat optimising a 500MWh BESS for Ørsted, and Quino Energy securing US$10 million in Series A funding.

headline: HD Renewable Energy secures 20-year offtake for 330MWh Templers BESS in South Australia
summary_80w: HDRE and Zen Energy have executed a 20-year power purchase agreement for the 111MW/330MWh Templers Battery Project in South Australia.

headline: AGL divests 19.9% Tilt Renewables stake to fund battery storage expansion
summary_80w: Australia’s AGL Energy has agreed to divest 19.9% of its equity interest in Tilt Renewables to Queensland Investment Corporation (QIC) and a Future Fund-led consortium for AU$750 million (US$488 million).

headline: Eco Stor launches construction on ‘milestone’ 700MWh Germany BESS project
summary_80w: BESS platform Eco Stor has marked the start of construction on a 300MW/700MWh BESS project in Germany, just days after RWE did the same.

headline: Plus Power secures US$160 million for New England BESS projects
summary_80w: Developer-operator Plus Power has secured US$160 million in tax equity investments from Morgan Stanley for two battery energy storage system (BESS) projects in Massachusetts and Maine, US.

headline: Germany: LEAG builds 1GW/4GWh largest BESS project in Europe, Fluence to supply tech
summary_80w: The low-carbon subsidiary of German energy company LEAG is constructing Europe’s largest single-site battery storage project, in partnership with Fluence.

headline: UK’s approved BESS pipeline grows to 162GWh, nearly 22GWh under construction
summary_80w: UK BESS projects totalling nearly 4GWh awarded planning consent in October, there is now nearly 22GWh under construction.

headline: VIDEO: Stop the 20% BESS revenue leak with warranty-grade data
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with Cellect, on how to protect your battery storage project from 'revenue leaks.'

headline: Trina Storage signs 5GWh battery storage supply agreement with Pacific Green Energy
summary_80w: Trina Storage has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Pacific Green Energy Group to supply up to 5GWh of battery energy storage systems between 2026 and 2028.

headline: GridStor’s 440MWh Texas BESS begins operations
summary_80w: Developer-operator GridStor’s 220MW/440MWh Hidden Lakes Reliability battery energy storage system (BESS) project in Texas, US, is now operational.
